title: South Africa's AMCU declares a dispute in wage talks with platinum firms
text:
The Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union (AMCU) President Joseph Mathunjwa (C) arrives at the Royal Bafokeng Stadium in Rustenburg, file. REUTERS/Skyler Reid

JOHANNESBURG (Reuters) - South Africa’s AMCU union General Secretary Jeff Mphalele said on Tuesday the union had declared a wage dispute with Anglo American Platinum and Sibanye-Stillwater raising concerns of a possible strike in the local platinum industry.

The Association of Mineworkers and Construction Union (AMCU), the majority union in the platinum sector, initially demanded a monthly basic wage hike of about 48% and said it was disappointed by a wage offer for workers at Lonmin, which was acquired by Sibanye this year.
